item.description:
The  snow is not quite ready for mid-season conditions so lets of a local hike.  this will be fairly short but still provide a decent Sunday morning workout.

Hike is 3 to 4 miles at the scenic Fells Reservation, just north of Boston (close to route 93). The trail will wind up and down with some rock scrambles but there are no sustained uphills. I suggest hiking shoes, jacket, snacks and plenty of water. Weather should be nice but at this time of year it is always a good idea to dress in layers.

If your Sunday plans include watching the Patriots this should be compatible, we will finish before 1pm kick-off.

We will meet at the Sheepfold parking lot at 9am sharp on Saturday morning. For Map of the Fells Reservation check out: http://www.mass.gov/dcr/parks/metroboston/maps/fells.gif

The Sheepfold is just about the center of the Fells reservation.
item.how_to_find_us: We will be at far end of parking lot near trail map

group.name: Boston Ski, Snowboard, and Outdoor Adventurers Meetup Group

item.name: Beginner hike in the Fells
